description.en: A Batch can have a unique identifier.
The production of the Batch started at a certain point in time (if recorded).
The production of the Batch finished at a certain point in time (if recorded).
ProductionEquipment belongs to a certain category. There can be multiple individual ProductionEquipment per category.
A Batch can recursively consist of other batches.

A uniform collection of tangible objects or Lot. This can either be a collection of produced items (i.e. the outflow of products) or a collection of raw material or required material (i.e. the inflow of products). It is assumed that the objects in a batch are similar and thus have shared attributes. Note that this definition is broader than the definition in IEC 61512 [i.8], which defines a batch as the material that is being produced (whereas in SAREF4INMA a batch can be items or materials).
